item.title: What is China thinking?  Really?
item.description:
Ramez Naam on Twitter

‚ÄúThis is an incredible analysis of how Putin‚Äôs invasion of the world will re-order the global world, largely for the better. By a leading Chinese policy thinker, in Shanghai, originally written in Chinese. Brief thread, but read the whole thing. https://t.co/o3KkayyhkQ 1/‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/ramez/status/1502895847301812224

source: Sunday assorted links

item.title: D to R donors by academic discipline
item.description:
Matthew Yglesias on Twitter

‚ÄúHere‚Äôs the ratio of D to R donors by academic discipline. Say 97% of Dem professors are wonderful people but 3% are assholes. Then in many fields you‚Äôre more likely to meet a professor who‚Äôs an Asshole Democrat than any kind of Republican. https://t.co/r0iCQAcioh‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/mattyglesias/status/1500980326759374851

source: Sunday assorted links

item.title: Can Putin pull back?
item.description:
Kamil Galeev on Twitter

‚ÄúHow to defeat Putin? Many recognise the importance of coercive measures against Russia and necessity to give it a way out And yet, some presume that the way out should be given to Putin to force him to negotiate. That‚Äôs a disastrous idea. There‚Äôs no way he can roll back nowüßµ‚Äù

URL: https://twitter.com/kamilkazani/status/1503053699798769666

source: Sunday assorted links

item.title: Globalization is not a politically antiseptic process
item.description:
Does Russia‚Äôs invasion of Ukraine indicate that the world has entered a new era of great-power rivalry and, potentially, conflict? Vladimir Putin‚Äôs stunning decisions to attack Ukraine, and the apparent blessing that he received from a Chinese government that also has designs on its neighbors, initially felt like a deeply ominous thing. But the difficul‚Ä¶

URL: https://ryanavent.substack.com/p/globalization-is-not-a-politically?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Monetary & Fiscal Policy in a Low-Interest Rate Economy, &

item.title: The Apple-TSMC Partnership
item.description:
The TSMC-Apple partnership has been one of the defining relationships of the mobile computing era. Without Apple as a predictable, high volume and demanding customer, it is unlikely that TSMC would have been able to catch up to Intel on advanced node semiconductor manufacturing. Similarly, without the support of the TSMC ecosystem, it is unlikely that A‚Ä¶

URL: https://semiconductor.substack.com/p/the-apple-tsmc-partnership?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

item.title: Interview: Andrew Gelman, statistician
item.description:
The past few decades have seen a flowering of empirical research and statistical methodologies. But that empirical revolution has severe growing pains ‚Äî a replication crisis that has researchers in numerous fields questioning how much they should trust their colleagues‚Äô results and taxpayers wondering how much wasted effort they should fund‚Ä¶

URL: https://noahpinion.substack.com/p/interview-andrew-gelman-statistician?utm_source=substack&utm_campaign=post_embed&utm_medium=web

source: Monetary & Fiscal Policy in a Low-Interest Rate Economy, &
